 3288: 
 3289: next_msg(_Pid) ->
 3290:     receive
 3291:         M -> M
 3292:     after 100 ->
 3293:               none
 3294:     end.
 3295: 
 3296: next_tmsg(Pid) ->    
 3297:     receive TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 3298:                       element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 3299:                       element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 3300:                 TMsg
 3301:     after 100 ->
 3302:               none
 3303:     end.
 3304: 
 3305: dummy_call(_) ->    
 3306:     ok.
 3307: 
 3308: tmpmem() ->
 3309:     erts_debug:alloc_blocks_size(temp_alloc).
 3310: 
 3311: verify_tmpmem(MemInfo) ->
 3312:     %%wait_for_test_procs(),
 3313:     case tmpmem() of
 3314: 	MemInfo ->
 3315: 	    io:format("Tmp mem info: ~p", [MemInfo]),
 3316: 	    case MemInfo of
 3317: 		{notsup,undefined} ->
 3318: 		    %% Use 'erl +Mea max' to do more complete memory leak testing.
 3319: 		    {comment,"Incomplete or no mem leak testing"};
 3320: 		_ ->
 3321: 		    ok
 3322: 	    end;
 3323: 	Other ->
 3324:             ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p", [MemInfo, Other])
 3325:     end.
 3326: 
 3327: call(Pid,Cmd) ->
 3328:     %%io:format("~p calling ~p with ~p\n",[self(), Pid, Cmd]),
 3329:     Pid ! {self(), Cmd},
 3330:     receive
 3331: 	{Pid,Reply} -> Reply
 3332:     end.
 3333: 
 3334: receive_any() ->
 3335:     receive M -> M end.	     
 3336: 
 3337: receive_any(Timeout) ->
 3338:     receive M -> M
 3339:     after Timeout -> timeout end.
 3340: 
 3341: flush() ->
 3342:     flush(1).
 3343: 
 3344: flush(0) ->
 3345:     flush(0, 10);  % don't waste too much time waiting for nothing
 3346: flush(N) ->
 3347:     flush(N, 1000).
 3348: 
 3349: flush(N, Timeout) ->
 3350:     receive M ->
 3351:             [M | flush(N-1)]
 3352:     after Timeout ->
 3353:             []
 3354:     end.
 3355: 
 3356: repeat(0, _, Arg) ->
 3357:     Arg;
 3358: repeat(N, Fun, Arg0) ->
 3359:     repeat(N-1, Fun, Fun(Arg0)).
 3360: 
 3361: repeat_while(Fun, Acc0) ->
 3362:     case Fun(Acc0) of
 3363:         false -> ok;
 3364:         Acc1 ->
 3365:             repeat_while(Fun, Acc1)
 3366:     end.
 3367: 
 3368: check(Exp,Got,Line) ->
 3369:     case Got of
 3370:  	Exp -> Exp;	    
 3371:   	_ ->
 3372: 	    io:format("CHECK at line ~p\nExpected: ~p\nGot     : ~p\n",
 3373:                       [Line,Exp,Got]),
 3374:  	    Got
 3375:     end.
 3376: 
 3377: nif_raise_exceptions(NifFunc) ->
 3378:     ExcTerms = [{error, test}, "a string", <<"a binary">>,
 3379:                 42, [1,2,3,4,5], [{p,1},{p,2},{p,3}]],
 3380:     lists:foldl(fun(Term, ok) ->
 3381:                         try
 3382:                             erlang:apply(?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term]),
 3383:                             ct:fail({expected,Term})
 3384:                         catch
 3385:                             error:Term:Stk ->
 3386:                                 [{?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term],_}|_] = Stk,
 3387:                                 ok
 3388:                         end
 3389:                 end, ok, ExcTerms).
 3390: 
 3391: -define(ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR, -9223372036854775808).
 3392: -define(TIME_UNITS, [second, millisecond, microsecond, nanosecond]).
 3393: 
 3394: nif_monotonic_time(_Config) ->
 3395:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = monotonic_time(invalid_time_unit),
 3396:     mtime_loop(1000000).
 3397: 
 3398: mtime_loop(0) ->
 3399:     ok;
 3400: mtime_loop(N) ->
 3401:     chk_mtime(?TIME_UNITS),
 3402:     mtime_loop(N-1).
 3403: 
 3404: chk_mtime([]) ->
 3405:     ok;
 3406: chk_mtime([TU|TUs]) ->
 3407:     A = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3408:     B = monotonic_time(TU),
 3409:     C = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3410:     try
 3411: 	true = A =< B,
 3412: 	true = B =< C
 3413:     catch
 3414: 	_ : _ ->
 3415: 	    ct:fail({monotonic_time_missmatch, TU, A, B, C})
 3416:     end,
 3417:     chk_mtime(TUs).
 3418: 
 3419: nif_time_offset(_Config) ->
 3420:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = time_offset(invalid_time_unit),
 3421:     toffs_loop(1000000).
 3422: 
 3423: toffs_loop(0) ->
 3424:     ok;
 3425: toffs_loop(N) ->
 3426:     chk_toffs(?TIME_UNITS),
 3427:     toffs_loop(N-1).
 3428: 
 3429: chk_toffs([]) ->
 3430:     ok;
 3431: chk_toffs([TU|TUs]) ->
 3432:     TO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3433:     NifTO = time_offset(TU),
 3434:     case TO =:= NifTO of
 3435:         true ->
 3436:             ok;
 3437:         false ->
 3438:             case erlang:system_info(time_warp_mode) of
 3439:                 no_time_warp ->
 3440:                     ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO});
 3441:                 _ ->
 3442:                     %% Most frequent time offset change
 3443:                     %% is currently only every 15:th
 3444:                     %% second so this should currently
 3445:                     %% work...
 3446:                     NTO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3447:                     case NifTO =:= NTO of
 3448:                         true ->
 3449:                             ok;
 3450:                         false ->
 3451:                             ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO, NTO})
 3452:                     end
 3453:             end
 3454:     end,
 3455:     chk_toffs(TUs).
 3456: 
 3457: nif_convert_time_unit(_Config) ->
 3458:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, second, invalid_time_unit),
 3459:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, second),
 3460:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, invalid_time_unit),
 3461:     lists:foreach(fun (Offset) ->
 3462:                           lists:foreach(fun (Diff) ->
 3463:                                                 chk_ctu(Diff+(Offset*1000*1000*1000))
 3464:                                         end,
 3465:                                         [999999999999,
 3466:                                          99999999999,
 3467:                                          9999999999,
 3468:                                          999999999,
 3469:                                          99999999,
 3470:                                          9999999,
 3471:                                          999999,
 3472:                                          99999,
 3473:                                          999,
 3474:                                          99,
 3475:                                          9,
 3476:                                          1,
 3477:                                          11,
 3478:                                          101,
 3479:                                          1001,
 3480:                                          10001,
 3481:                                          100001,
 3482:                                          1000001,
 3483:                                          10000001,
 3484:                                          100000001,
 3485:                                          1000000001,
 3486:                                          100000000001,
 3487:                                          1000000000001,
 3488:                                          5,
 3489:                                          50,
 3490:                                          500,
 3491:                                          5000,
 3492:                                          50000,
 3493:                                          500000,
 3494:                                          5000000,
 3495:                                          50000000,
 3496:                                          500000000,
 3497:                                          5000000000,
 3498:                                          50000000000,
 3499:                                          500000000000])
 3500:                   end,
 3501:                   [-4711, -1000, -475, -5, -4, -3, -2, -1, 0,
 3502:                    1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 475, 1000, 4711]),
 3503:     ctu_loop(1000000).
 3504: 
 3505: ctu_loop(0) ->
 3506:     ok;
 3507: ctu_loop(N) ->
 3508:     chk_ctu(erlang:monotonic_time(nanosecond)),
 3509:     ctu_loop(N-1).
 3510: 
 3511: chk_ctu(Time) ->
 3512:     chk_ctu(Time, ?TIME_UNITS).
 3513: 
 3514: chk_ctu(_Time, []) ->
 3515:     ok;
 3516: chk_ctu(Time, [FromTU|FromTUs]) ->
 3517:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ?TIME_UNITS),
 3518:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTUs).
 3519: 
 3520: chk_ctu(_Time, _FromTU, []) ->
 3521:     ok;
 3522: chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, [ToTU|ToTUs]) ->
 3523:     T = erlang:convert_time_unit(Time, nanosecond, FromTU),
 3524:     TE = erlang:convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3525:     TN = convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3526:     case TE =:= TN of
 3527: 	false ->
 3528: 	    ct:fail({conversion_mismatch, FromTU, T, ToTU, TE, TN});
 3529: 	true ->
 3530: 	    chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ToTUs)
 3531:     end.
 3532: 
 3533: nif_now_time(Config) ->
 3534:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3535: 
 3536:     N1 = now(),
 3537:     NifN1 = now_time(),
 3538:     NifN2 = now_time(),
 3539:     N2 = now(),
 3540:     true = N1 < NifN1,
 3541:     true = NifN1 < NifN2,
 3542:     true = NifN2 < N2.
 3543: 
 3544: nif_cpu_time(Config) ->
 3545:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3546: 
 3547:     try cpu_time() of
 3548:         {_, _, _} ->
 3549:             ok
 3550:     catch error:badarg ->
 3551:             {comment, "cpu_time not supported"}
 3552:     end.
 3553: 
 3554: nif_unique_integer(Config) ->
 3555:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3556: 
 3557:     UM1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3558:     UM2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic]),
 3559:     UM3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3560: 
 3561:     true = UM1 < UM2,
 3562:     true = UM2 < UM3,
 3563: 
 3564:     UMP1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3565:     UMP2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic, positive]),
 3566:     UMP3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3567: 
 3568:     true = 0 =< UMP1,
 3569:     true = UMP1 < UMP2,
 3570:     true = UMP2 < UMP3,
 3571: 
 3572:     UP1 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3573:     UP2 = unique_integer_nif([positive]),
 3574:     UP3 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3575: 
 3576:     true = 0 =< UP1,
 3577:     true = 0 =< UP2,
 3578:     true = 0 =< UP3,
 3579: 
 3580:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3581:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3582:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])).
 3583: 
 3584: nif_is_process_alive(Config) ->
 3585:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3586: 
 3587:     {Pid,_} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> receive ok -> nok end end),
 3588:     true = is_process_alive_nif(Pid),
 3589:     exit(Pid, die),
 3590:     receive _ -> ok end, %% Clear monitor
 3591:     false = is_process_alive_nif(Pid).
 3592: 
 3593: nif_is_port_alive(Config) ->
 3594:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3595: 
 3596:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3597:     true = is_port_alive_nif(Port),
 3598:     port_close(Port),
 3599:     false = is_port_alive_nif(Port).
 3600: 
 3601: nif_term_to_binary(Config) ->
 3602:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3603:     T = {#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3604:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3605:     ct:log("~p",[Bin]),
 3606:     Bin = term_to_binary_nif(T, undefined),
 3607:     true = term_to_binary_nif(T, self()),
 3608:     receive Bin -> ok end.
 3609: 
 3610: -define(ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE, 16#20000000).
 3611: 
 3612: nif_binary_to_term(Config) ->
 3613:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3614:     BigMap = maps:from_list([{I,-I} || I <- lists:seq(1,100)]),
 3615:     [nif_binary_to_term_do(T)
 3616:      || T <- [{#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3617:               atom, 42, self(), BigMap]],
 3618:     ok.
 3619: 
 3620: nif_binary_to_term_do(T) ->
 3621:     Dummy = [true|false],
 3622:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3623:     Len = byte_size(Bin),
 3624:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 0),
 3625:     Len = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, self(), 0),
 3626:     {T,Dummy} = receive M -> M after 1000 -> timeout end,
 3627: 
 3628:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3629:     false = binary_to_term_nif(<<131,100,0,14,"undefined_atom">>,
 3630:                                undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3631:     false = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 1),
 3632:     ok.
 3633: 
 3634: nif_port_command(Config) ->
 3635:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3636: 
 3637:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3638:     true = port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n"),
 3639:     receive {Port,{data,"hello\n"}} -> ok
 3640:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3641: 
 3642:     RefcBin = lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(100, "hello"),"\n"]),
 3643:     true = port_command_nif(Port, iolist_to_binary(RefcBin)),
 3644:     receive {Port,{data,RefcBin}} -> ok
 3645:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3646: 
 3647:     %% Test that invalid arguments correctly returns
 3648:     %% badarg and that the port survives.
 3649:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, [ok])),
 3650: 
 3651:     IoList = [lists:duplicate(100,<<"hello">>),"\n"],
 3652:     true = port_command_nif(Port, [IoList]),
 3653:     FlatIoList = binary_to_list(iolist_to_binary(IoList)),
 3654:     receive {Port,{data,FlatIoList}} -> ok
 3655:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3656: 
 3657:     port_close(Port),
 3658: 
 3659:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n")),
 3660:     ok.
 3661: 
 3662: nif_snprintf(Config) ->
 3663:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3664:     <<"ok",0>> = format_term_nif(3,ok),
 3665:     <<"o",0>>  = format_term_nif(2,ok),
 3666:     <<"\"hello world\"",0>> = format_term_nif(14,"hello world"),
 3667:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},3.14",_/binary>> = format_term_nif(50,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3668:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},",0>> = format_term_nif(20,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3669:     ok.
 3670: 
 3671: nif_internal_hash(Config) ->
 3672:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3673:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal),
 3674:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3675:     HashValues = [hash_nif(internal, Term, 0) || Term <- Terms],
 3676:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3677: 
 3678: nif_internal_hash_salted(Config) ->
 3679:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3680:     test_salted_nif_hash(internal).
 3681: 
 3682: nif_phash2(Config) ->
 3683:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3684:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2),
 3685:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3686:     HashValues =
 3687:         lists:map(
 3688:           fun (Term) ->
 3689:                   HashValue = erlang:phash2(Term),
 3690:                   Salt = random_uint32(), % phash2 should ignore salt
 3691:                   NifHashValue = hash_nif(phash2, Term, Salt),
 3692:                   (HashValue =:= NifHashValue
 3693:                    orelse ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p",
 3694:                                   [HashValue, NifHashValue])),
 3695:                   HashValue
 3696:           end,
 3697:           Terms),
 3698:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3699: 
 3700: test_salted_nif_hash(HashType) ->
 3701:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(HashType),
 3702:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3703:     Salts = unique([random_uint32() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 50)]),
 3704:     {HashValuesPerSalt, HashValuesPerTerm} =
 3705:         lists:mapfoldl(
 3706:           fun (Salt, Acc) ->
 3707:                   {HashValues, NewAcc} =
 3708:                     lists:mapfoldl(
 3709:                       fun (Term, AccB) ->
 3710:                               HashValue = hash_nif(HashType, Term, Salt),
 3711:                               NewAccB = dict:append(Term, HashValue, AccB),
 3712:                               {HashValue, NewAccB}
 3713:                       end,
 3714:                       Acc,
 3715:                       Terms),
 3716:                   {{Salt, HashValues}, NewAcc}
 3717:           end,
 3718:           dict:new(),
 3719:           Salts),
 3720: 
 3721:     % Test per-salt hash distribution of different terms
 3722:     lists:foreach(
 3723:       fun ({_Salt, HashValues}) ->
 3724:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize)
 3725:       end,
 3726:       HashValuesPerSalt),
 3727: 
 3728:     % Test per-term hash distribution of different salts
 3729:     dict:fold(
 3730:       fun (_Term, HashValues, Acc) ->
 3731:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize),
 3732:               Acc
 3733:       end,
 3734:       ok,
 3735:       HashValuesPerTerm).
 3736: 
 3737: test_bit_distribution_fitness(Integers, BitSize) ->
 3738:     MaxInteger = (1 bsl BitSize) - 1,
 3739:     OnesPerBit =
 3740:         lists:foldl(
 3741:           fun (Integer, Acc) when Integer >= 0, Integer =< MaxInteger ->
 3742:                   lists:foldl(
 3743:                     fun (BitIndex, AccB) ->
 3744:                             BitValue = (Integer band (1 bsl BitIndex)) bsr BitIndex,
 3745:                             orddict:update_counter(BitIndex, BitValue, AccB)
 3746:                     end,
 3747:                     Acc,
 3748:                     lists:seq(0, BitSize - 1))
 3749:           end,
 3750:           orddict:new(),
 3751:           Integers),
 3752: 
 3753:     N = length(Integers),
 3754:     ExpectedNrOfOnes = N div 2,
 3755:     %% ExpectedNrOfOnes should have a binomial distribution
 3756:     %% with a standard deviation as:
 3757:     ExpectedStdDev = math:sqrt(N) / 2,
 3758:     %% which can be approximated as a normal distribution
 3759:     %% where we allow a deviation of 6 std.devs
 3760:     %% for a fail probability of 0.000000002:
 3761:     MaxStdDevs = 6,
 3762: 
 3763:     FailureText =
 3764:         orddict:fold(
 3765:           fun (BitIndex, NrOfOnes, Acc) ->
 3766:                   Deviation = abs(NrOfOnes - ExpectedNrOfOnes) / ExpectedStdDev,
 3767:                   case Deviation >= MaxStdDevs of
 3768:                       false ->
 3769:                           Acc;
 3770:                       true ->
 3771:                           [Acc,
 3772:                            io_lib:format(
 3773:                              "Unreasonable deviation on number of set bits (i=~p): "
 3774:                              "expected ~p, got ~p (# std.dev ~.3f > ~p)~n",
 3775:                              [BitIndex, ExpectedNrOfOnes, NrOfOnes, Deviation, MaxStdDevs])]
 3776:                   end
 3777:           end,
 3778:           [],
 3779:           OnesPerBit),
 3780: 
 3781:     (FailureText =:= [] orelse ct:fail(FailureText)).
 3782: 
 3783: nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal) -> erlang:system_info(wordsize) * 8;
 3784: nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2) -> 27.
 3785: 
 3786: unique(List) ->
 3787:     lists:usort(List).
 3788: 
 3789: random_uint32() ->
 3790:     rand:uniform(1 bsl 32) - 1.
 3791: 
 3792: random_term() ->
 3793:     case rand:uniform(6) of
 3794:         1 -> rand:uniform(1 bsl 27) - 1; % small
 3795:         2 -> (1 bsl 27) + rand:uniform(1 bsl 128); % big
 3796:         3 -> random_sign() * (rand:uniform() * (1 bsl 53)); % float
 3797:         4 -> random_binary();
 3798:         5 -> random_pid();
 3799:         6 ->
 3800:             Length = rand:uniform(10),
 3801:             List = [random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, Length)],
 3802:             case rand:uniform(2) of
 3803:                 1 ->
 3804:                    List;
 3805:                 2 ->
 3806:                    list_to_tuple(List)
 3807:             end
 3808:     end.
 3809: 
 3810: random_sign() ->
 3811:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 3812:         1 -> -1.0;
 3813:         2 -> 1.0
 3814:     end.
 3815: 
 3816: random_binary() ->
 3817:     rand:bytes(rand:uniform(32) - 1).
 3818: 
 3819: random_pid() ->
 3820:     Processes = erlang:processes(),
 3821:     lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Processes)), Processes).
 3822: 
 3823: %% Test enif_whereis_...
 3824: 
 3825: nif_whereis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3826:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3827: 
 3828:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_thing,
 3829:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3830:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3831: 
 3832:     Mgr = self(),
 3833:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3834:     ProcMsg = {Ref, ?LINE},
 3835:     PortMsg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis hello\n",
 3836: 
 3837:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [Ref]),
 3838:     true = register(RegName, Pid),
 3839:     Pid = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3840:     Pid = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3841:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3842:     false = whereis_term(pid, [RegName]),
 3843: 
 3844:     ok = whereis_send(pid, RegName, {forward, Mgr, ProcMsg}),
 3845:     ok = receive ProcMsg -> ok end,
 3846: 
 3847:     Pid ! {Ref, quit},
 3848:     ok = receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end,
 3849:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3850:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3851: 
 3852:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 3853:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 3854:     Port = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3855:     Port = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3856:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3857:     false = whereis_term(port, [RegName]),
 3858: 
 3859:     ok = whereis_send(port, RegName, PortMsg),
 3860:     ok = receive {Port, {data, PortMsg}} -> ok end,
 3861: 
 3862:     port_close(Port),
 3863:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3864:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3865:     ok.
 3866: 
 3867: nif_whereis_parallel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3868:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3869: 
 3870:     %% try to be at least a little asymmetric
 3871:     NProcs = trunc(3.7 * erlang:system_info(schedulers)),
 3872:     NSeq = lists:seq(1, NProcs),
 3873:     Names = [list_to_atom("nif_whereis_proc_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
 3874:             || N <- NSeq],
 3875:     Mgr = self(),
 3876:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3877: 
 3878:     NotReg = fun(Name) ->
 3879:         erlang:whereis(Name) == undefined
 3880:     end,
 3881:     PidReg = fun({Name, Pid, _Mon}) ->
 3882:         erlang:whereis(Name) == Pid andalso whereis_term(pid, Name) == Pid
 3883:     end,
 3884:     RecvDown = fun({_Name, Pid, Mon}) ->
 3885:         receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> true
 3886:         after   1500 -> false end
 3887:     end,
 3888:     RecvNum = fun(N) ->
 3889:         receive {N, Ref} -> true
 3890:         after   1500 -> false end
 3891:     end,
 3892: 
 3893:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 3894: 
 3895:     %% {Name, Pid, Mon}
 3896:     Procs = lists:map(
 3897:         fun(N) ->
 3898:             Name = lists:nth(N, Names),
 3899:             Prev = lists:nth((if N == 1 -> NProcs; true -> (N - 1) end), Names),
 3900:             Next = lists:nth((if N == NProcs -> 1; true -> (N + 1) end), Names),
 3901:             {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 3902:                 ?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [{N, Ref, Mgr, [Prev, Next]}]),
 3903:             true = register(Name, Pid),
 3904:             {Name, Pid, Mon}
 3905:         end, NSeq),
 3906: 
 3907:     true = lists:all(PidReg, Procs),
 3908: 
 3909:     %% tell them all to 'fire' as fast as we can
 3910:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 3911:                        [P ! {Ref, send_proc} || {_, P, _} <- Procs]
 3912:                end, void),
 3913: 
 3914:     %% each gets forwarded through two processes
 3915:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 3916:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq),
 3917:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq)
 3918:                end, void),
 3919: 
 3920:     %% tell them all to 'quit' by name
 3921:     [N ! {Ref, quit} || {N, _, _} <- Procs],
 3922:     true = lists:all(RecvDown, Procs),
 3923:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 3924:     ok.
 3925: 
 3926: nif_whereis_threaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3927:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3928: 
 3929:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_threaded,
 3930:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3931: 
 3932:     Self = self(),
 3933:     true = register(RegName, Self),
 3934: 
 3935:     {ok, ProcThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(pid, RegName, "dtor to proc"),
 3936:     {ok, Self} = whereis_thd_result(ProcThr),
 3937: 
 3938:     nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName).
 3939: 
 3940: nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName) ->
 3941:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 3942:     "dtor to proc" = receive_any(1000),
 3943:     true = unregister(RegName),
 3944: 
 3945:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 3946:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 3947: 
 3948:     {ok, PortThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(port, RegName, "dtor to port"),
 3949:     {ok, Port} = whereis_thd_result(PortThr),
 3950: 
 3951:     nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port).
 3952: 
 3953: nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port) ->
 3954:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 3955:     {Port, {data, "dtor to port"}} = receive_any(1000),
 3956: 
 3957:     port_close(Port),
 3958:     ok.
 3959: 
 3960: %% exported to be spawned by MFA by whereis tests
 3961: nif_whereis_proxy({N, Ref, Mgr, Targets} = Args) ->
 3962:     receive
 3963:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 3964:             To ! Data,
 3965:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 3966:         {Ref, quit} ->
 3967:             ok;
 3968:         {Ref, send_port} ->
 3969:             Msg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ "\n",
 3970:             lists:foreach(
 3971:                 fun(T) ->
 3972:                     ok = whereis_send(port, T, Msg)
 3973:                 end, Targets),
 3974:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 3975:         {Ref, send_proc} ->
 3976:             lists:foreach(
 3977:                 fun(T) ->
 3978:                     ok = whereis_send(pid, T, {forward, Mgr, {N, Ref}})
 3979:                 end, Targets),
 3980:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args)
 3981:     end;
 3982: nif_whereis_proxy(Ref) ->
 3983:     receive
 3984:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 3985:             To ! Data,
 3986:             nif_whereis_proxy(Ref);
 3987:         {Ref, quit} ->
 3988:             ok
 3989:     end.
 3990: nif_ioq(Config) ->
 3991:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3992: 
 3993:     Script =
 3994:         [{create, a},
 3995: 
 3996:          %% Test enq of erlang term binary
 3997:          {enqb,   a},
 3998:          {enqb,   a, 3},
 3999: 
 4000:          %% Test enq of non-erlang term binary
 4001:          {enqbraw,a},
 4002:          {enqbraw,a, 5},
 4003:          {peek,   a},
 4004:          {peek_head,  a},
 4005:          {deq,    a, 42},
 4006: 
 4007:          %% Test enqv
 4008:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 4009:          {peek_head,  a},
 4010:          {deq,    a, all},
 4011: 
 4012:          %% This skips all elements but one in the iolist
 4013:          {enqv,   a, 5, iolist_size(nif_ioq_payload(5)) - 1},
 4014:          {peek_head,  a},
 4015:          {peek,   a},
 4016: 
 4017:          %% Ensure that enqueued refc binaries are intact after a roundtrip.
 4018:          %%
 4019:          %% This test and the ones immediately following it does not go through
 4020:          %% erlang:iolist_to_iovec/1
 4021:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4022:          {peek,   a},
 4023: 
 4024:          %% ... heap binaries
 4025:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4026:          {peek,   a},
 4027: 
 4028:          %% ... plain sub-binaries
 4029:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(subbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4030:          {peek,   a},
 4031: 
 4032:          %% ... unaligned binaries
 4033:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4034:          {peek,   a},
 4035: 
 4036:          %% Enq stuff to destroy with data in queue
 4037:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 4038:          {destroy,a},
 4039: 
 4040:          %% Test destroy of new queue
 4041:          {create, a},
 4042:          {destroy,a}
 4043:         ],
 4044: 
 4045:     nif_ioq_run(Script),
 4046: 
 4047:     %% Test that only enif_inspect_as_vec works
 4048:     Payload = nif_ioq_payload(5),
 4049:     PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(Payload),
 4050: 
 4051:     [begin
 4052:          PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,Payload,Stack,Env)),
 4053:          <<>>       = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,[],Stack,Env))
 4054:      end || Stack <- [no_stack, use_stack], Env <- [use_env, no_env]],
 4055: 
 4056:     %% Test error cases
 4057: 
 4058:     Q = ioq_nif(create),
 4059: 
 4060:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4061: 
 4062:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(deq, Q, 1)),
 4063:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, 1, 1234)),
 4064: 
 4065:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4066: 
 4067:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [atom_in_list], 0)),
 4068:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [make_ref()], 0)),
 4069:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [256], 0)),
 4070:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [-1], 0)),
 4071:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [#{}], 0)),
 4072:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [1 bsl 64], 0)),
 4073:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [{tuple}], 0)),
 4074: 
 4075:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4076: 
 4077:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [atom_in_list], use_stack)),
 4078:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [make_ref()], no_stack)),
 4079:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [256], use_stack)),
 4080:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [-1], no_stack)),
 4081:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [#{}], use_stack)),
 4082:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [1 bsl 64], no_stack)),
 4083:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [{tuple}], use_stack)),
 4084:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  <<"binary">>, use_stack)),
 4085: 
 4086:     ioq_nif(destroy, Q),
 4087: 
 4088:     %% Test that the example in the docs works
 4089:     ExampleQ = ioq_nif(create),
 4090:     true = ioq_nif(example, ExampleQ, nif_ioq_payload(5)),
 4091:     ioq_nif(destroy, ExampleQ),
 4092: 
 4093:     ok.
 4094: 
 4095: 
 4096: nif_ioq_run(Script) ->
 4097:     nif_ioq_run(Script, #{}).
 4098: 
 4099: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name}|T], State)
 4100:   when Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4101:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin}|T], State);
 4102: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, Skip}|T], State)
 4103:   when Action =:= enqb, is_integer(Skip);
 4104:        Action =:= enqbraw, is_integer(Skip) ->
 4105:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin, Skip}|T], State);
 4106: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N}|T], State)
 4107:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4108:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, 0}|T], State);
 4109: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, Skip}|T], State)
 4110:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4111: 
 4112:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4113:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4114: 
 4115:     %% Sanitize the log output a bit so that it doesn't become too large.
 4116:     H = {Action, Name, try iolist_size(N) of Sz -> Sz catch _:_ -> N end, Skip},
 4117:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4118: 
 4119:     Data = nif_ioq_payload(N),
 4120:     ioq_nif(Action, IOQ, Data, Skip),
 4121: 
 4122:     <<_:Skip/binary, SkippedData/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4123: 
 4124:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == (iolist_size([B|SkippedData])),
 4125: 
 4126:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := Q#{ b := [B|SkippedData]}});
 4127: nif_ioq_run([{peek, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4128:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4129:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4130: 
 4131:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4132: 
 4133:     Data = ioq_nif(peek, IOQ, ioq_nif(size, IOQ)),
 4134: 
 4135:     true = iolist_to_binary(B) == iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4136:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4137: nif_ioq_run([{peek_head, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4138:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4139:     RefData = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4140: 
 4141:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4142: 
 4143:     {true, QueueHead} = ioq_nif(peek_head, IOQ),
 4144:     true = byte_size(QueueHead) > 0,
 4145: 
 4146:     {RefHead, _Tail} = split_binary(RefData, byte_size(QueueHead)),
 4147: 
 4148:     true = QueueHead =:= RefHead,
 4149: 
 4150:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4151: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, all}|T], State) ->
 4152:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4153:     Size = ioq_nif(size, IOQ),
 4154:     true = Size == iolist_size(B),
 4155:     nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, Size}|T], State);
 4156: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, N} = H|T], State) ->
 4157:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4158:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4159: 
 4160:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4161: 
 4162:     <<_:N/binary,Remain/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4163:     NewQ = Q#{ b := Remain },
 4164: 
 4165:     Sz = ioq_nif(deq, IOQ, N),
 4166: 
 4167:     true = Sz == iolist_size(Remain),
 4168:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(Remain),
 4169: 
 4170:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := NewQ });
 4171: nif_ioq_run([{create, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4172:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4173:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name => #{ q => ioq_nif(create), b => [] } });
 4174: nif_ioq_run([{destroy, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4175:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4176:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4177: 
 4178:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4179: 
 4180:     ioq_nif(destroy, IOQ),
 4181: 
 4182:     nif_ioq_run(T, maps:remove(Name, State));
 4183: nif_ioq_run([], State) ->
 4184:     State.
 4185: 
 4186: nif_ioq_payload(N) when is_integer(N) ->
 4187:     Tail = if N > 3 -> nif_ioq_payload(N-3); true -> [] end,
 4188:     Head = element(1, lists:split(N,[nif_ioq_payload(subbin),
 4189:                                      nif_ioq_payload(heapbin),
 4190:                                      nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4191:                                      nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) | Tail])),
 4192:     erlang:iolist_to_iovec(Head);
 4193: nif_ioq_payload(subbin) ->
 4194:     Bin = nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4195:     Sz = size(Bin) - 1,
 4196:     <<_:8,SubBin:Sz/binary,_/bits>> = Bin,
 4197:     SubBin;
 4198: nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) ->
 4199:     make_unaligned_binary(<< <<I>> || I <- lists:seq(1, 255) >>);
 4200: nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) ->
 4201:     <<"a literal heap binary">>;
 4202: nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) ->
 4203:     iolist_to_binary([lists:seq(1,255) || _ <- lists:seq(1,255)]);
 4204: nif_ioq_payload(Else) ->
 4205:     Else.
 4206: 
 4207: make_unaligned_binary(Bin0) ->
 4208:     Size = byte_size(Bin0),
 4209:     <<0:3,Bin:Size/binary,31:5>> = id(<<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>),
 4210:     Bin.
 4211: 
 4212: pid(Config) ->
 4213:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4214:     Self = self(),
 4215:     {true, ErlNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Self),
 4216:     false = is_pid_undefined_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4217:     Self = make_pid_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4218: 
 4219:     UndefPid = set_pid_undefined_nif(),
 4220:     true = is_pid_undefined_nif(UndefPid),
 4221:     undefined = make_pid_nif(UndefPid),
 4222:     0 = send_term(UndefPid, message),
 4223: 
 4224:     Other = spawn(fun() -> ok end),
 4225:     {true,OtherNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Other),
 4226:     Cmp = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, OtherNifPid),
 4227:     true = if Cmp < 0 -> Self < Other;
 4228:               Cmp > 0 -> Self > Other
 4229:            end,
 4230:     0 = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, ErlNifPid),
 4231: 
 4232:     {false, _} = get_local_pid_nif(undefined),
 4233:     ok.
 4234: 
 4235: nif_term_type(Config) ->
 4236:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4237: 
 4238:     atom = term_type_nif(atom),
 4239: 
 4240:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:1>>),
 4241:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:8>>),
 4242: 
 4243:     float = term_type_nif(0.0),
 4244: 
 4245:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun external:function/1),
 4246:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun(A) -> A end),
 4247:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun id/1),
 4248: 
 4249:     integer = term_type_nif(1 bsl 1024),        %Bignum.
 4250:     integer = term_type_nif(1),
 4251: 
 4252:     list = term_type_nif([list]),
 4253:     list = term_type_nif([]),
 4254: 
 4255:     LargeMap = maps:from_list([{N, N} || N <- lists:seq(1, 256)]),
 4256:     map = term_type_nif(LargeMap),
 4257:     map = term_type_nif(#{ small => map }),
 4258: 
 4259:     pid = term_type_nif(self()),
 4260: 
 4261:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 4262:     port = term_type_nif(Port),
 4263:     port_close(Port),
 4264: 
 4265:     reference = term_type_nif(make_ref()),
 4266: 
 4267:     tuple = term_type_nif({}),
 4268: 
 4269:     ok.
 4270: 
 4271: %% Verify match state arguments are not passed to declared NIFs.
 4272: match_state_arg(Config) ->
 4273:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4274:     Bin = term_to_binary([<<"x">> | Config]), % a non-literal binary with an $x byte
 4275:     <<"nif says ok">> = msa_find_x_y(Bin),
 4276:     ok.
 4277: 
 4278: %% Without declaring msa_find_y_nif/1 as NIF, the compiler would do
 4279: %% optimization and pass it a match state as argument.
 4280: msa_find_x_y(<<$x, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4281:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4282: msa_find_x_y(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4283:     msa_find_x_y(Rest);
 4284: msa_find_x_y(<<>>) ->
 4285:     "no x".
 4286: 
 4287: msa_find_y_nif(<<$y, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4288:     Rest;
 4289: msa_find_y_nif(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4290:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4291: msa_find_y_nif(<<>>) ->
 4292:     "no y".
 4293: 
 4294: 
 4295: last_resource_dtor_call() ->
 4296:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, aux_work),
 4297:     last_resource_dtor_call_nif().
 4298: 
 4299: id(I) -> I.
 4300: keep_alive(Term) -> ?MODULE:id(Term).
